definition:
Let $K$ be any field of characteristic $p > 0$, and suppose $K$ contains
the finite field $\mathbb{F}_q$ of size $q$, where $q = p^r$. The
$q^{\rm th}$ power Frobenius map on $K$ is the map
${\operatorname{Frob}}_q: K \longrightarrow K$ defined by
${\operatorname{Frob}}_q(x) := x^q$.

If $K$ is perfect, then ${\operatorname{Frob}}_q$ is an automorphism of
$K$ which fixes $\mathbb{F}_q$, and accordingly is a member of the
Galois group $\operatorname{Gal}(K/\mathbb{F}_q)$.
